intro: Lappula rupicola, commonly known as the rock lappula, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible seeds. The plant typically grows in crevices and on slopes, adapting to harsh, dry environments. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in dense clusters, and the leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Lappula rupicola is characterized by its ability to thrive in poor soils and its resilience to drought conditions.
